comments.text: We stood there with a sign Poland, a lot of PL,CZ, SK plates, great spot if you want do a lot of kilomiters on one stop
Good spot, many drivers stop. 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), Tuesday, 15 mins

I was waiting at exit for 2h20min on Friday afternoon in August, direction to CZ. Tried with sign and also without. Two cars stops, both to Germany. Finally, I took drive to Brno. A lot of full cars with families...
Last gas station before Vienna/Bratislava junction. Got a ride to Bratislava in 10 mins!
Absolutely possible to get a ride not just to Wien, but also towards Bratislava or Brno! :)

I got a car directly to Szeged with a sing Szeged!!! Just 5 minutes waiting! Maybe just lucky ! But this place looks easy for HH to the south! Even if you get stuck in the evening is good for camping and eat KFC
At night it was took so long to get a ride to Szeged. Anyway it must be one of the best hitch places in Hungary.
On an eastern sunny day, not so many people on the road. After getting many no's with bad faces, a couple took me 100 km away away from here.
Ask a group for a lift to Kecskem√©t
Not only quickly got a ride. Quickly got a ride with the band Irie Mafia straight into the Szeged Festival. Good place.
Had a lift to Balaton lake but 3 drivers stopped before for shorter distance. Great spot
If you wanna go to Balaton this spot also very good.
great spot after the roundabout. if you are lucky, you\\'ll have a ride till gy≈ër at least.
Roadkill Gourmet was here

Wonderful place to Croatia or Kaposv√°r / Lake Balaton. The exit of the roundabout, and there is a bus stop so you have all of the possibilities to get a lift. I needed only 10 sec to get a lift by a truck :)
We didn't even finished writing the sing and some guy offered us ride
many people going to szeged, good place to go there
Mid September in rain got a ride in 1h30. Sunny summers must be easy!
excellent spot! got a lift to vienna and met the love of my life on this ride.
nothing beats this spot
good for Serbia
good for Kecskemet
slow cars, many cars
Very good sport, after roundabout and bus stop, plenty of place to stop, good traffic, got a ride quickly to Budapest
perfect place going towards oradea
perfect little bus stop, most people are going straight to Budapest
perfect little bus stop on a hill, ONLY GO LONG DISTANCES DONT GET STUCK INSIDE SIOFOK

The first car stopped and took me to Vienna
Enough space to stop and cars are going slowly and have enough time to see you
Quickly got picked up all the way to Budapest
Ni provis iri kiel eble plej suden, do mi kaj Chad disiƒùis, kaj provis amba≈≠ vojojn samtempe. Ni trovis unu al B√°tasz√©k.
First car gave us a ride to Tiszaujvaros.
Sign "Barcs". Got a ride into Croatia.
Bus stop
Had many offers going into Pecs but we tried waiting for a ride through Pecs. After 20mins decided to accept one anyway.
Race around the lake, hitchhikers vs hikers. The hitchhikers won.
Race around the lake, hitchhikers vs hikers. The hitchhikers won.
Didn‚Äòt take long but was also just a short ride
I was waiting here for 30 minutes and got ride to Eger (Debrecin direction).
Thumbed there. It worked perfectly.

Good for getting rides in Vienna/Bratislava direction space to stop and traffic not moving too fast. I stood a little before the bridge to be more visible and so there‚Äôs more space to stop. But under would be good for rain.
The road is literally called "road to Moh√°cs" so the first person we asked took us xD
We got a ride to Budapest in under 5 Minutes

It's a really good spot. All of the cars to Hungary are passing by really slow. And there is a lot of space for the them to stop. Don't take the first ride to the next gas station and wait for the cars with longer destination. Spot is better then a gas station

I was there solo man. First I tried it with sign Tokyo (just joke) but didn‚Äôt go well‚Ä¶ so I change it to Debrecen and in 5 minutes I get ride to Cluj. There is small bus stop where is enough space for cars and also is it right after traffic lights.

Perfect spot for finding a ride. We just stood with signs right in front of the exit from the parking. Really good for Vienna/Bratislava/Gy≈ër  direction. We got a very funny ride. The story is not shareable for safety and legal reasons, but it would make a good chapter in traveling book.

Good spot if you're going to Kecskemet. There is a room for stopping and cars are going slower there because of the roundabout. You have Aldi and Tesco nearby and a huge statue of Jesus or whoever, so if you're relligous you have a higher chance people will stop you.
Great spot to HH. Lots of place to stop. Cars and trucks do not go fast due to urban zone speed limit. Got a lift in no time with truck driver to Bielsko-Bia≈Ça in Poland. We used sign "PL".
Lots of place to stop, however cars go quite fast. We were using the sign "PL"
Lots of place to stop. Got a short ride to the main road.
beautiful place. we were just before gas station in Slovakia. 2hrs. than moved here. one big family in 2 cars took use to Oradea directly!
Great spot, people see you and you can stand in the bus station
Nice village. Great cheese. Lots of cars both directions, some spots with shade and enough space to pull over.
Got picked up immediatly. Nice guy took me to motorway service station, even tho it was a few extra kms for him.
Cars are slowing down and there are many of them

Chat this shit is crazy i was playing the game of odds with my bro and he had to fuck the asphalt for 30 seconds üòí. A car passed by and the guy inside stopped ‚úãÔ∏è maybe he thought we needed some help and even though he didn't speak English we got a ride to the next gas station. Crazy story üòú and the worst part is that he smelled so bad üëé üò´ üò™ üò© üòî GET OUT I could feel the horrible smell of onion the whole time ‚è≤Ô∏è üò¢  and that's the crazy story of how ü§î we got a ride üò≥ üòë üòê without even tr
Me and my boyfriend got a ride directly to Budapest after 5 min. It was the first time hitchhiking for my bf:)
Easy to reach veszprem or balaton, just ask drivers

Big amount of cars to Romania. You can very easily aim Szeged in one  
I tried at the gas station onAustrian  side and then restaurant on Hungarian side.
Side note: slept near the gas station and got woken up at 4am by Austrian military
perfect spot, many cars, got a ride in 15 mins all the way to Sibiu
A lot of cars going there in-depth to Hungary. I got lucky and was immediately picked up by police to Szeged's train station.
Amazing spot for diverse travels. We had a place to be - hence the longer time - but we got offered rides to nearby cities, as well as cities like Kyiv and eventually all the way to Moldova
Its a bus stop, easy to stop for cars also.
Just after the bridge, there's a lot of space to stop

Such a miracle spot - we were convinced that we would catch somebody at the spot before us at the same road but apparently the road has changed so much that there was no place to stop. We just kept walking forward and found this temporary stop for truck drivers - it isn't huge but allows for some braking. We held the sign for less than 20 seconds we got a ride from a Romanian gentleman who got us straight to Cluj Napoca.
#autostopchallenge
Excellent spot towards Eger. I hitchhiked here many times and never had to wait more than 5 minutes.
Great spot to the east (Miskolc) and North (Bogacs and Eger). Cars slow down in the roundabout, plenty of space for them to stop.

waited here 15-30 min and then got a ride to budapest. tried the spot ~400m before that one (at the tir parking before), that didn‚Äôt go well cause the traffic there was just too fast. at the entrance to this roundabout, it was just perfect. cars are mostly local, but the trucks will give you the ride :)
We got a ride with truck driver to Vara≈ædin. This is a good spot to Croatia. There is a MC Donald and some truck drivers stops here
Managed to meet a guy heading to Serbia

Best spot towards BUDAPEST,or M3. Used over 50 times.  

‚ÄïUtcabetyar, August 2023

Hometown of UTCABETYAR!

The best place to hitchhike in the direction of Hortob√°gy, Debrecen, Egyek. I use it a lot.
Best spot towards BUDAPEST,EGER or M3. Used over 50 times. Cross the railway!!! I started many of my tours here. Among them is the Tiszaf√ºred - Nordkapp tour.
Walk to the exact spot! Leave roundabout and cross the railway and stay by the apple juice factory :-) . Used it over 100 times. this is a good spot to reach the M3 higway towards MISKOLC,BUDAPEST...
Used it many times direction NY√çRL√ñV≈ê,KISV√ÅRDA. Small village. On the spot is a bar and grocery too.

I use it in 1982 first time. Since them used many times. Small village with nice people. This is a bus stop. Here is a bar and a grocery markt too! It is not worth it to walk away from this point direction KISV√ÅRDA.
A lovely spot. Cars need to slow down because of the roundabout. Great visibility. Good traffic. We were waiting with a Keszthely sign and we got a lift to Zanka after maybe even less 10 mins.
Bus stop with great visibility. We got a lift to Keszthely after 10 mins. Good traffic.
Very good spot, lot of cars, keen on stopping, going towards the highway and then Budapest
Nice landscape, good visibily, easy stop for drivers, many cars stopped, ofther short rides
I got a ride to Budapest in matter of minutes. I was standing with a sign.
A lot of people from mcdonalds pass through. Ideal to get to Wien or Bratislava.
Great place if you are going towards Budapest or Gy≈ër
This is an awesome place, where you will get direct rides to Budapest. :) Stand at the very end of it!
I've got a straight ride to Budapest while asking the drivers abd waited like 5 mins :D
Towards Budapest
A German guy stopped and drove me all the way to the Serbian border. Probably better than anywhere inside Budapest proper

We waited at the entrance of the petrol station for two hours with a sign that said: Szeged Rom√°nia fel√©. One car stopped, but we had too much luggage (two people, two backpacks, two instruments) and then two turkish truckers took us to the border of Turkey in two days.
Great spot for going to Romanka lots of traffic , and can be reached by a bus from Budapest for 650 HUF
Huge traffic and lots of trucks, also nice facilities. If you're going south to Szeged, it's a great spot.
Thumbing didn't work here. So we tried to ask around. Though this is tough as a non-Hungarian speaker. But that worked for us

On Saturday morning it is not a busy gas station but I got a direct car to Debrecen after 30 minutes. Although it is diffucult place becasue you have to check the cars by the gas station, behind the gas station and at the door of the McDonalds. So you will run a lot between these 3 places, but you will catch a car to east (Miskolc, Debrecen, Ny√≠regyh√°za) and north (Salg√≥tarj√°n) really easy.
... and the KFC is open non-stop! :)
I was waiting here for nearly 45 minutes but then a family took me towards east, so pretty cool place, VERY frequent!
I had to wait a bit longer due to on national holidays for trucks it's prohibited to leave the parking lots and i had to search for the driver who takes me towards Miskolc
Race around the lake, hitchhikers vs hikers. The hitchhikers won.
Hitching while walking to the village. First car took us.

We weren't sure of the spot because we didn't get the attention of the most of the cars already on the road, but a few cars sometimes work well too. They could just stop a little on the pedestrian way and others cars could still go.

Well, I would suggest walking on the other side of the junction and standing next to the road on the grass there. There is a spot where the cars can stop for you. I was standing there with a friend, and the second car which passed picked us up.
Direction: P√©cs

Managed to hitch a ride straight to Romania. Plenty of traffic towards Hungary, Romania and Serbia, especially on fridays and saturdays. Great spot certainly worth the walk from the nearest Bratislava bus stop ("ƒåunovsk√© jazer√°").

We waited with sign Budapest, one guy who was going to Croatia around Budapest took us just after like 5-10 mins. There is a good amount of traffic, best place to stand is at the end where the place is connecting to the highway. Also a lot of trucks, so can be good for solo hitching.
You can also hitch straight from the highway in the part where cars drive 60. Best imo is the spot where cars/trucks taking a rest get on the highway again.

There is a snack bar with exchange office, that is selling also the Vignette "highway tax". Traffic was quite low (December) but the first car that wew asked (and only present) gave us a ride to Budapest. There is little traffic but basically everybody is going at least to Budapest. You can reach this hitchhiking point from Bratislava, taking a bus from the Faculty of Economics to Rajka (tickets on the bus 1,50‚Ç¨ full, 0,75‚Ç¨ students). Stop at the first of the 2 stops in Rajka (one stop before th
good spot do debrecen/oradea
Facila veturo al Szeksz√°rd, la unua de la tago, la celo estis iri al Kupra en Bosnio, kaj ni decidis preni ƒâi tiun vojon de Szeksz√°rd kvankam ≈ùajnas kontra≈≠diro reveni.

Ni faris ≈ùildon por ke la teamo de la maljunulino kaj la kato povu iri unue, ƒâar ili estis prioritataj, poste alia teamo alvenis de alia trako de tramprennen. Ni uzis la saman ≈ùildon kaj iris tuj post la unua teamo kaj ni demetis la ≈ùildon por ke ili anka≈≠ povu foriri de tie rapide kaj facile.
Border cross, but both countryes are in shengen so no waiting. Guy took us over the whole hungary.
Amazing spot to go east! We met two guys there who wanted to go to Cluj, they were gone within 20 minutes. Then we waited for another 20 and had a direct ride to Oradea
A good spot before the gas station where cars cana pull over. We (2 people) hitchhikers with a sign to eger and got a ride to the center of it from a lady that never picked up anyone before.
A little place to stop. Got a ride to Vac, where we were dropped off in good place where you can put tent for the night.
1h waited to go M5 Szeged, but no one took us. Much local traffic. Wen't to the patrol Station next and got a ride after 15min though it doesn't look very ideal.
Good spot! A nice guy from Sgezedin took us to the borders with Serbia!

Very good spot !
We was 2, with a big sign to give our destination. There is many cars passing and a good space for them to stop. 
The only bad things is that there is a lot of pollution because of the highway. And the cars goes fast.
We waited about 45 mins then some nice people took us to Szeged , okay spot just after the traffic lights.
The spot seemed good but we waited for more than one hour. The cars seemed to not be able to stop even with the ramp.

I waited two hours but it was a low traffic day and eventually there was some works on the gas station. Definitely the best place to go west ! Got a ride to Leipzig. If you really want to go to Germany it's completely doable there's a lot of Germans. Actually more than Austrians haha. But you have to talk to them. I waited almost two hours at the exit of the gas station then I decided to talk directly to the gas station and I was offered also a ride by a bus driver for free to Graz at the same m

Probably the best spot for hitchhiking from Budapest towards Vienna/Bratislava/Prague, you have to take a train from Budapest city centre and then a 3 km walk to get here though. Used thumbs up and sign Wien/Bratislava, snatched a ride after like 90 minutes (2 people), a single seat ride was offered to us after like 30 minutes.

A good spot to catch a drive to Gyor/Vienna. There is a place a the exit of the gas station where the cars cana pull over as they enter the highway, you can also ask the drivers. Harder to get there, you have to get a bus from budapest and then walk for about 30 min. We (2 people) catched a romanian guy going to K√∂ln, and he drive as to Vienna.
Unfortunately trucks don't stop at this Gas station. It doesn't work to come here from the city but public transportation because it takes to long.
Perfect spot to pull over right by the exit. Got a ride in 5 seconds, first car stopped for me. Quality spot
long distance
this is bus stop, perfect place to Szeged,old road to border Hungary/Serbia
Got a ride to Krakow in 5 minutes. Slow traffic and everyone heading for Slovakia is coming through here because the highway is not finished.
We stayed here for 5 minutes and guy took us to the Sziks√≥.
Really good for either direction Kosice or Satoraljaujhely.
After an hour we hitchhiked a kind lady who drove us to the Slovenian border.

Not very high traffic but there are many cars with Slovene license plates that probably go to Slovenia. If nothing else, you should get a short lift across the border. We got a lift all the ay to Ljubljana. It might also be a good idea to go to the next village where the road 86 is bringing trucks from Slovakia going to Slovenia.

really nice place where.
The rest of road towards P√∂rboly is unusable for hitchhiking
There is a bus stop and an emergency lane where the cars can stop. Good for the direction to B√°tasz√©k, Moh√°cs or P√©cs.

A good spot to get out of Eger, we (2 people) catched a ride straightbto budapest. Best to stand at the start of the bus bay, siƒô the cars have where to stop and slightly to the road because there is a lamp blocking the view.
On top of the small hill there is a bus station. Try to hitchhike in front of that, so the cars can easily stop. Good place to get a ride to Budapest.
Very sweet spot. 5 Mim wait. Cars going at 50kmh and just one lane
there are a plenty of cars going to the direction of Fony√≥d (southern coast of Balaton).
Our direction was Balaton. At first, we had the sign for Ljubljana, but nobody reacted to that. When we changed it to Balaton, a very kind lady stopped for us within 20 minutes.

Well, the place looks really nice for stop. However today I waited near 4 hours to take a stop, idk why. People in cars looks like they dont know what is autostop, weirdy looking. Also two pathology guys are screaming at me and coming, but got scared after I showed peppergas. Thats my opinion, the place looks really well for taking stop. It's before autobahn, and cars have place to stop to take you.
Awesome place to Balaton.

Spent one hour in the gas station behind McDonald's, had to share the same place with other HHer and got nothing. Cars go too fast they can't even see you probably.

Got a bus to this spot and got a ride to Balaton in under 10 min. Really nice area to stop and actually look to the drivers.
Good place to go Balaton
Bad place, we wait more than 3 hrs and nothing...
Many cars going to Germany, as well as some Hungarian and Polish. We cought a lift to Warsaw from here.

It was cold night already. We did not want to sleep outside because it was very cold so we just put a sign on the table with ,,Home,, written on it and stayed in the gas station. Fortunatelly it is open nonstop. To our surprise a lot of people came in. One car was full otherwise they would take us with them but after a while two Polish guys took us with them near Slovak borders. We spent the night in their car, then got a breakfast and then they took us near Nov√Ω Jiƒç√≠n in Czechia
An awesome spot to hitch a ride to Budapest. Stand at the very end of it, because from the back there is also a lane with traffic, which goes up to the motorway as well.
In theory sweet spot, in practice it took an hour to find a car going to Budapest. Seems like a very decent spot though. As usual on hungarian petrol stations - caution advised at night.
its a good spot to Debrecen, lots of cars are going there, but its not the best for Miskolc or Slovenia. Its better to ask a drivers.

By night, got dropped on the wrong side of the station, walked across the highway by night (absolutely not recommended, hyper dodgy). But then asked cars showing the city name of Ny√≠regyh√°za and got a ride with th 3rd car asked.

Not a good spot for hitchhiking, but good for asking the people.
The guy from the gas station took us 30 km farther.

It took me 50 minutes on foot to get there from Mosonmagyarovar train station. However, it totally worth it, because every car, passing the spot, goes towards Slovakian border/straight to Bratislava. I was lifted to the border.
a lot of Slovakia cars.
Good spot for trip to Serbia
We just asked people on the gas statsion and after 15 min we found a car even to Romania :)
Perfect place to hitch, although it was hard to get a direct ride to Serbia. To Szeged should be easy from here.
Big petrol station direction Szeged/Serbia.
3 guys we managed to get a ride quickly together to a gas station before Szeged, in order to go to Serbia.

With patience and some Luck you can get a ride to Oradea, Maybe Cluj. Much more traffic going to Arad though. If you are heading to the Northern part of Romania, consider going via Arad, once you're in Ro hitching will go much faster!
Good Place just before a mcdonalds, fairly easy to get to Szeged
Got a ride in less than 2 minutes to the South with a "Szeged" sign
You get to Budapest faster by hitchhiking than with public transport. I used this spot very frequently as I live in Sahy

Not big traffic but many cars are going to Poland and it's easy to be visible as everyone is driving slowly. There's also a bar/restaurant so many buses are stopping there. Might be possible to get a ride with them. We got direct ride to Krakow in 30 minutes.
Good chance to get a ride to Poland directly.
border point on the krakow-budapest route. border posts are still there, cars need to slow down, pretty okay place.
Was quickly picked up by locals, and dropped off at the border. A lot of cars passing by to Romania
* 'not to the one'

Because I can not edit the map I write my experience here. I got a direct car to Gy≈ër from here ( I could go futher to Austria because the driver went there). I admit I had lucky because on Sunday morning the petrol station is not busy, on Sunday afternoon a lot of car step by. You have to go to the second Mol station in the front of M√°l√≥ Panzi√≥, the to the one by the road circle.
I hitched many times to Romania from here, it is no better spot around every car  to Romania passes by, as I remember the most time I waited was around 1 h, even at night.

Small bay to park - so we should be very good viewed. I get from here to Oradea. When I stayed in roundabout for 1h I resigned from it i got here - after almost 30 minutes I catched one (there is not plenty of cars from Romania here, so I must waited longer).
Awesome and very frequent hitchhiking spot, good luck with that! :)
You can reach this spot with the trolley bus 74. Get off at S√ÅRR√âT PARK station, and head LEFT to the motorway. (seearch for green wind barrier walls)
A very nice spot for direction EAST (Miskolc, Ny√≠regyh√°za, Debrecen).

Good place. You can also take bus 5. I was taking it from Ferenciek tere. I can't remember the bus stop, but might be R√°kospatak utca. I got there a little late, around 5:30PM. I had a sign, written Ny√≠regyh√°za on it. Around 6PM a guy stopped and he was going to Eger, which is half way, He was really nice and took me to the petrol station just before turning to the direction of Eger. From there I easily got a ride to the petrol station at Polg√°r and with a third car I got to Ny√≠regyh√°za. I had a
A really good place, you can get here by going the yellow metro to Mexico ut (the last station) and then taking a bus no. 25
gas station and mcdonalds right before the highway towards eastern hungary, you can go here using a bus and try catch something to the SHELL gas station with mcdonalds before highway
I had a car on Tuesday from here to Hatvan (the driver went to Ny√≠regyh√°za). I was lucky because most of the drivers were local and did not go too far, they stayed at Budapest.

I got a car from here to the Parktiker by the border of Budapest after 20 minutes. This place is not the best for a car to east. A lof of car came around the streets nearby, so if you catch here a direct car to Miskolc or Debrecen you are really lucky. But as I said, you can get a car to the next two stations by the OMV by Kacs√≥h Pongr√°c or by the Praktiker near G√∂d√∂ll≈ë. From there you have a easy ride.
we were two, waiting on the afternoon trying to get to aszod, eventually we took a bus

This place was horrible for us. There were we two guys. One of us stood with a table and the other was asking people on the gas station. No one stoped and had enough place or the same direction, like us. After 2,5 hours a man could ride us until Hatvan. (Our destination was Miskolc). If you just stand with a table side of the road, you maybe waste your time!
I was asking people at the gas station and got a ride to Budapest really quick

It is good spot to Budapest or Romania. There was not but we wanted to go to Balaton. And it was really bad. After hour we went to adk drivers directly And after another 30 minutes we got a ride to a better gas station in Budapest.
Great spot to BP.
Not a lot of cars but after 30 min we got a car to Budapest.
Same experience as in the description. Good spot to get a ride to BP.
Nice spot. Lots of trucks which are going slow because of the border and everybody waves at you at least. Guy took me to Bratislava

Still a great spot to catch ride to Hungary, but remember, that around 2020 they opened new highway few km north. 
So over here there is less traffic, but still good. 
We got ride to Debrecen, and were stuck for 2h because wanted to go to Slovakia

I always walk the Ro/Hu border, Pop my shield at the Vignette place. You can get long distance rides if you fancy waiting for them and decline the short ones. Longest rides I got were to Nurnberg and Linz
I was twice there, once a driver took me to Vienna, once to Budapest, waiting time was 5 minutes for both. Very good spot!
Perfect place for Budapest and more, lot of long distances cars and trucks
Very easy, didn't get very far but it was far enough to continue on the country road :-)
Driver took me to Derecske
Thank u for the precise description. It was really helpful to know already the bus line.
You can get there by bus no. 44. You have to get off right after turn. There is also Aldi supermarket

Bus station next to a crossing so drivers from two directions have enough time seeing you holding your sign for a city in the south (Beretty√É¬≥√É¬∫jfalu is the next one) or Romania. Reachable by bus. The modern busses have screens that show the bus running on a map. Easy to orientate and to figure out the right direction
Got a ride to Szeged after 5 minutes. Big up to Hungarian.  Thanks Olshi and Jordi!
Instantly found a ride to szeged
At first we tried to stop at a nearby bus station for about 1,5 hours. However the cars are quite fast. We then moved to this gas station, where two guys picked us up and brought us to Szeged

Try to hitchhike to Timisoara at a on-ramp in Dunaharesti first, after two hours switched to that Spot, got a ride to Szeged in a good hour.
Lot of traffic, space to stop.
The spot is good. Enough place for the cars to stop, lots of traffic. I think i was just unlucky. A sign is definitely necessary here.

Quite a good place to stop, but not on the main road yet. After one and a half hour of waiting, which is a bit much even for two guys with big backpacks, a nice driver picked us up and brought us past Ullo, where the road 4 actually starts.

Easy to access, safe place and lots of cars, which are going long distance. Take a train ticket from Nyugati to Vecses (15 min walk from tranin station) there is a bus stop and just a cardboard is enough with Szolnok on it. I was alone and two soldier picked me up.
One guy, just after sunset, sign read Szolnok... got a lift from a cool russian dude straight to Szolnok after about 15 minutes of waiting.
Direct to Szeged with locals.
I was heading to Budapest and had to wait almost 2 hours for a ride. This highway was surprisingly empty.

If you get dropped at the border and need a ride to Szeged, this is the place for thumbing! Don't expect a big traffic, but many cars would stop for you. Hitchhiked several times from here, maximum waiting time was 15-20 minutes.
Not much traffic but lots of people going north to Slovakia poland so if you ask over and over eventually someone will take you. Me and Mati got a ride to brezno (northern slovakia)üá∏üá∞

We were hitch-hiking there on Sunday and the traffic was extremely low. Basically local drivers. We were moving between station and entrance to the station on the highway and it took us 3-4 hours to find a ride to the boarder (which was much easier to find a ride to Poland).
Probably during the week it's much better.

To get there you can, for example, hitchhike here: http://hitchwiki.org/maps/?place=1682 - since there are quite many drivers going to V√°c - and ask them to stop on Shell station. Most of the cars on the station are going to V√°c or other nearby places in Hungary, but from time to time there are coming drivers from different countries and truck drivers. Personally, I was waiting a little bit less than half an hour directly to Cracow, but it is important to add, that it was a long May weekend in P
Its a small parking and a toilet. Not much cars, but more trucks. I lucky got  ride with the truck to Presov. (1 girl)

Good spot to the Miskolc.
We stayed there only 10 minutes.
10 minutes, and got a ride near the HR-HU border
Direction south, Croatia.
Stood with a sign saying SRB, an Estonian guy driving to Greece took me all the way to Novi Sad and gave me 20‚Ç¨ and an apple
Not many cars are going here and most of them are full. We stood in front of the entrance to the shop and asked people. We were lucky and found someone after 15 min who took us to Novi Sad.
There is good space, truck drivers can see u when stop for chech. Also there is space for car drivers to stop. 2 Ukrainian guys take me a ride to Budapest center. Trafic is not really insane.
Many truck drivers stop there for controls, very good spot to catch a ride to Budapest

February 14, 2023. Not exactly high season for hitchhiking, and we started from Budapest late in the afternoon. So for us (2), this spot was a bit risky, we were afraid that we would have to spend the night there. Eventually we went up to a person and asked if he could take us and he said yes. I imagine this station has more traffic in the summer during the day.
My favourite spot in Hungary. Always the first car stopped for me.
good for Szeged
mostly local cars
Bona loko por kaj Budape≈ùto kaj Hatvan, se vi haltas en Hatvan petu lasi vin ƒâe la benzinstacio ƒâe la ƒâefstrato.
Bona loko. Ili veturigis min kaj la teamon Piggyback al la sekva urbo, dum alia teamo veturigis rekte al Budape≈ùto.
Not the best but you‚Äôll get picked up eventually, an Encs sign probably works better than a Miskolc one

Not a lot of room for cars to stop but traffic not intense so ok. Got a lift to Budapest after using the thumb for 3 minutes! Thanks Olshi. You can also try to get closer to the highway from here I guess. Cheers guy

ƒài tio estis la plej amuza. La teamo Maljunulino kaj la Kato (la gajninto) haltis al ni en a≈≠to, kiun ili jam petveturis, kaj poste, kiam ni estis vundeblaj metante niajn dorsosakojn en la a≈≠ton, la TBA-teamo anka≈≠ haltis tre rapide kaj atakis nian flagon, kiel veraj piratoj, beda≈≠rinde por ni.
Race around the lake, hitchhikers vs hikers. The hitchhikers won.

A quiet gas station. We just sat in front of the shop with a sign. Within 10 minutes we had 2 offers and they discussed who had the best ride for us. In the end the guy that took us dropped us exactly where we needed to go.
Lot‚Äòs of option but mostly only short rides to the next city in croatia
Not a lot of space but i got stop to border with Slovenia in 15 minutes, i standed with sign to Szombathely

We used this spot to go to the Serbian border. Not many cars going to the highway/to Serbia from here, mostly local traffic. There is a traffic light that‚Äôs red very often for the cars, so they stand a lot and can see you well. There is space to pick you up.

Good for people going to Vienna visible to people coming out of the gas station and traffic has enough time to see you and stop safely. Vary out of the way only ended up there because my last driver went out of his way to go past Sopron where he was.
We stood in front of the bus station, there is enough space to stop and the cars don't go super fast. Took us 15 minutes to get a ride to the next town on our way to romania
Cars are pretty fast, but there is also a gas station near by where you can ask
Small street with not much cars
A lot of space for people to stop
A bit quiet for its size, but still enough cars. I got offered a ride to Miskolc before I started asking
Good place to get a ride from Szeged towards Serbian border
Waited for about 30 minutes with a sign Szeged, little cover from the sun but at least there's a KFC nearby
Kinda good spot if you want to go to balaton. Got your hike in 5 min or so. But there is not a perfect space for cars to stop, just a small dirt place.
There is a roadwork on the highway so all the traffic going north is coming through here but as soon as the works finish, the spot is useless
Hard to get there and fast traffic but at least all traffic goes to the right direction
Its easy to find a ride to Seged from Morahalom. We went to the highway exit.
Local traffic, we waited 30 minutes and someone picked us up to the train station of Balatonf√ºred :)
restaurant visited by many travellers coming from and going to Romania, it's open 24/7, so always people there to ask, food is great too :)

We reached late at night and decided to wait for the morning to continue hitchhiking. The restaurant is cheap, the food is good and it's open 24h. There's also a 24h service station with cozy sofas to sleep in and power sockets. Buy water at the service station rather than the restaurant, it's 5 times cheaper for the same amount. In the morning a truck driver gave us a lift to Lugoj in Romania, although we could have gone further to Sibiu.
There are many Romanians passing by, go talk to the peo
Many romanian trucks. I asked to be dropped in a gaz station toward Szeged

Orlen gas station on the right for cardboard and on the other side a good spot in front of a sign ‚ÄúLetenye‚Äù, there is a spot to stop for cars behind. Choose right time, we had no luck in the evening but in the morning, took us maybe 15mins. PS: 2 girls
Hitchhiked towards Serbian border on Saturday. Pretty heavy traffic, but most of the cars were full. Finally, got a lift to the border by a driver who works nearby.

We slept on this petrol station not much trafic at night, in the morning one truck took us near the Rajka border cross, I think It will be a good spot to go to Budapest or  to east. However for us It was wors spot during the trip cuz we spent there like 13 hours but with sleep
Good place to stop at the end of a line
Not a lot of traffic but many people that ride here are going to Eger avoiding the motorway
Many cars are commuting from Hungary to Austria every day, so maybe you can catch a car at the morning. It took me 40 minutes.
No "normal" traffic just families and hikers visiting the tourist station of Bankut, so few cars. I got instants lifts here though.
Very low traffic, but cars tend to stop. We hitchhike here every year and never had to wait more than 20 minutes. Sit down on the curb and enjoy the weather.
I suposse we were lucky, our friends waited 2h and got train to next city where comunnication seemed better
Hometown of UTCABETYAR. Two main roads (33,34) converge. There is a lamp. This is a bus stop. I prefer to walk to the end of the city towards Hortob√°gy, Debrecen.

Quite good spot, but there is no space to pull in the car. We waited with 20 mins with the sign Balaton, but I think we got lucky not to wait that long. The visibility is good and cars are slowing down because there is this intersection and this is a road without right of way.

Very little traffic, and in 30 min only few cara went to highway. 
But some guys were going to Miskolc, and took us

we we're waiting at the exit towards budapest (the streets name is europai utak on google maps), cars from the highway as well as from the traffic diversion as well as from the gas station come this way. not a lot of traffic in general. we were pretty lucky and someone picked us up.
Sketchy to pull over but doable as not many people drive there. Lights to hitchhike at night.
I can see how it would be a good spot but a lot of fast moving traffic makes it more about luck for me. Saw some A and CZ license plates but no stoppers
dont bother ask just sign from the entrance by the motorway. mostly commuter traffic ~6pm weekday. hard to tell if i got lucky or if its an okay spot.

Not the best spot but not sure where else you should go. It gets the job done eventually. A lot of cars on 3 lanes and they're going very fast. The gas station is very quiet so getting cars from there is of no use. Waited for almost 2 hours as a solo guy, sunday 6pm until a ride to Gy√∂r. Tried sign and no sign.
Quite a quiet petrol station with majority of traffic going M1 rather than M7. Eventually got a lift to Hungarian boarder though.
A guy took us near lake Balaton with his huge RAM truck. A HH couple was already sitting in the car, but i would say this spot is better than the other.
Talked to people at petrol station for an hour. Basically all local traffic. Stood on slipway with no success. Better to move to petrol station further down even if it was a lot quieter.

I didn't end up getting a lift here, gave up and got the train. It's probably an okay place to hitchhike from, but it was loud and drivers didn't look particularly pleased to see me hitch hiking.... I am fairly new to hitchhiking, but this is the first time I felt unsafe/unwelcome.
Autumn, 2024

Best nearby place to hitchhike in direction Wien. Started 9 am on a Friday. Make sure to stand along the highway, as you'll have a much better chance than if you stand within the gas station. The guy who picked me up said he saw hitchhikers 30 meters or so in front of me (which you can see as a pin on hitchmap), but he wouldn't have been able to pick them up, as it was hard to stop. So hitch from here!!
Got a ride to pecs.
October 15: Still under construction. DONT go to the McD and the petrol station but use the petrol station 100m after!
Nobody pick me, just get flamed by the gas station
Perfect spot. Many cars.
It looks like a great spot to Balaton. First driver just after few minutes was ready to give us a ride but then he took off. And then we waited another hour for lift to Osifok.
50 minutes for two guys, early in the Friday morning. We took drive to Gyor.
Gave up after almost 2 hours. The place looks good, but somehow no one stops.
I talked to like 4 people, the fourth one told me he can travel with me to croatia boundary:)
Not many cars, but if you stay on crossing roads from the city, and the station It is not that bad. Less than 30 minutes after 22
You should walk to the crossing (exit of the rest area, and the entrance from the city) there isnt to much place, but a lot of drivers go towards Lake Balaton
took forever on a saturday afternoon, though many pass on the on ramp nobody is willing to stop (are already too fast) asking, even though there are very few will be the best option
not that great spot, not so much cars. better talk to drivers. I hitched from here to Slovenia severa times.

Wait with a big sign on the lawn after the Hungarian border control. So people can already see you/read the sign when their passports get checked. Great spot with space behind to park. Got a direct lift to Budapest with sign. A lot of people are probably afraid of taking a possible refugee and getting into problems. I think a creative sign could help, people have enough time to read it. Many German and Austrian cars.

We were hitchhiking in the evening during sunset. Some truck driver talked to us for some time so we could not hitchhike for that time. Lot of Austrian and German cars passing by but they did not stop us. After a while two guys from Hungary took us to Kecskemet

I waited for more than 2 hours here. There were many cars with German or Austrian number plates but nobody stopped. They were coming from turkey and were fully loaded with stuff and people. Luckily a truck driver stopped and brought me to a petrol station near budapest.
Very hard to get a lift... (2 guys). It's better to go down to OMV petrol station, where you can ask truck drivers. There we got lift to Lublin (PL)
Direct lift to Cracov PL in 5 min (;
This place is not really good for you if you don't like a long wait, yet it was perfect place to stay overnight nearby the fence. The other morning we catched a car to Budapest.

There's many rest stops on this road, and I'm not sure which one I was dropped off at because my ride did not speak any english, but I got extremely lucky and was dropped off literally in front of another ride (Romanian) that at first drove me to Budapest and then accepted to take me all the way to Arad, Romania. This is extreme luck on my behalf though, so be careful with these rest stops, they can be hit or miss. Stop at a petrol station up ahead (ask for "benzink√∫t") or at the Austrian/ Hunga

i used this spot for Budapest [Blog Post](http://www.hobospirit.com/bratislava-to-oradea-romania/) and a second time for Vienna in the other direction too [Blog Post](http://www.hobospirit.com/nadlac-romaniahungary-border-to-memmingen-airport-germany/)
We had lift from here directly to Brno - CZ (in August).
Quite a small resting with toilets, but the number of cars here quickly turns. Good for asking. Toward Austria, Slovakia and Czech Republic.
There is good place to stay nier roadsign, but almost all drivers going to local vilages. In 2h 4 cars stoped but all going to nearest vilages.

People go to local villiages, got a lift to local village in 20 mins at 6 am
 (Couple)
i asked people at the petrol station but most of them stayed in town, finally got a lift to lenti after 30mins

If you're in Nagykanizsa and want to go to Slovenia or Croatia then this is the best spot. Average waiting time for a couple is 10 minutes. All the cars go to local villages, so you should try and reach Letenye, and from there hitch a ride to Croatia or Slovenia.
There's also a petrol station near Becsehely where trucks stop, you can try to get a ride there.
Thumbing at the exit worked well. We got a lift on the M3.

at least in the morning (7am) there wasnt much traffic, and what there was was locals or going to Wien, not much for Bratislava. Got a ride to Gy√∂r eventually. wildcampers can walk from here into the woods or by the lakes nearby where they could find some chill places to sleep.

Agree. Not exactly busy, but there's still a constant amount of cars. I asked every driver stopping at the gas station and got a direct ride to Vienna within an hour - which is ok. The staff at the gas station is indifferent towards hitchhikers. So no problem here.
Wed. morning, few cars at the rest stop, still after only 4 min got a ride to Mosonmagyar√≥v√°r. People goin mostly to Vienna, some to Bratislava.

A petrol station near Tatab√°nya on a direction to Budapest (from Gy√∂r and Wien).
Quite distant from city, so cars stopping here are going far.

You should NOT hitchhike here. First there is always heavy traffic on this road and the cars have very little space to stop so it is dangerous.

Second: car at this spot goes to very different directions. Some will take the highway, some will go to north some to east.

It is an extremely inpractial spot. You should go couple hundred meters to east either to the highway intersection (if you'll go towards Budapest or Debrecen) or to over the big roundabout under the bridge.

Honestly I have

This place was awesome for me! After 2 minutes a drvier picked me up! (maybe it was a luck) There is an intersection and a traffic lights, the road from the Metro Supermarket joins here, which is long, and the cars can stop.
We tried to go in direction if Zagreb or M7 gas station. No one stopped and traffic seemed not very friendly
very good place to hitchike... the cars have to stop  for around 2 minutes because  trains have to pass from here

It seems to be a pretty good place to hitchhiking in the direction of Budapest. There is a gas station, a large parking lot for which trucks and passenger cars stand. The station can be reached directly from the E60 road. We tried to catch transport from there to Budapest (from where we wanted to go further towards Belgrade) we were lucky and we came across a driver from Serbia who easily offered us a ride to Belgrade. In general, the traffic is quite high and a lot of locals and tourists. (Ther
It wasnt a huge traffic here on Thursday. Some cars, som trucks. It took me 45 minutes to get a ride to Budapest. I think the best place is the end of the parking where 3-4 roads come into one
many trucks, but only few cars.

i was not hitching from here but someone let me out at this place on a vienna - gyoer trip in january 2010. the petrol station seems to be busy and cars that stop (fuel/rest) here definitely travel furtheron to BUDAPEST or in the direction of romania/bulgaria.
Our direction was Slovenia, Ljubljana. Nobody stopped. We stood there from morning until the afternoon and still no one. In the evening, we finally took a train.
We got first stop bit quickly, but the guy did not understand us well so he took off. And than got ride about 20 or 30 minutes latter. It is quite good spot
Got a ride to the border with Croatia in 15min. Nice spot.
Same as others: bad spot in the noon/afternoon. Didn't got a car. Also no Romanian cars, so I guess it's only good for Budapest. Only good thing is nearby auchan.
Update 2024. Got a truck in approximately 30 minutes in the morning. Straight to Budapest.take a sign.

I have the same experiment as the previous comment said. This is not a good place if you want to leave Szeged at noon. I suggest the next bus stop in front of the Nagybani piac at the roundabouts by the highway, but hard to say. In the morning you could get a better chance to have a lift from here. (anyway the bus stop is near the Budapesti √∫t, the point suggest a forest road, so you have to stay at the "Ny√°ri tanya" bus stop)

This was the second time I hitched here and was terrible. We waited 2 hours with my girlfriend trying to get a ride towards Budapest on a Thursday afternoon. As we ran out of time, decided to take the bus. Lots of cars passing, but the ones who stopped for us were going to villages nearby. Maybe the problem was that we didn't have a sign. I don't know, because the other time this spot worked really well.
This is a good spot! You can get close to here by bus 72 from the centre. There's a bus stop after the roundabout. It works perfectly towards the motorway. 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), 15 mins
We got very lucky the guy went exactly to Si√≥fok. Still looks like a great place to find rides, almost all the cars go to Balaton.
No cars
35 min on a Sat. afternoon for a very short ride to gas station Szfv√°r, where it took forever to continue :|, generally good though
a gas station between budapest and the balaton, not too busy but all the traffic goes the right way, also some local traffic entering (for thumbing) or just getting gas (not so good)
2 person got a ride stright to Italy to Padova

We (2 persons) were going to Zagreb and ok it's not a good spot for this direction but we were picked by a young, very nice truck driver (cement truck) so maybe you can have the chance to be picked by him, he does hungary/zagreb every day :)
Most truck traffic stopped here is going all the way to Italy via Slovenia.  Not good if you are trying to go to Croatia.
[08.08.2010] most people drove still to the balaton, instead of give us a ride southwest to Zagreb. full tourist cars mostly!
long distances
I thought it's a great place, but not...we have been waited here half on hour, beautiful sunny weather, good traffic, but no lift.
In direction Budapest it‚Äôs probably better than any bus stop around because you get all the traffic. There are two lanes so cars can stop kinda safely
It's risky, as there's not much action going on. We got lucky. There's probably better places to hitch for Budapest.
Might be ok for other directions but it took me 4.5 hours to get a ride to M5, direction Szeged
Might be ok for other directions but i waited 4,5 hours for a lift to M5, direction Szeged :(
Good place, but further from the city (bus stops close from it) and you have to walk though roundabouts. I asked truck drivers around and got a ride to Romania soon :)

This spot is excellent for both directions, as there is a parking with petrol station and amenities on both sides. I used it several times and never had to wait too long. There are a lot of long range trucks, it is convenient to get a ride to Germany, Austria, France or the Netherlands. From the other side Romania or Turkey is also possible. The only drawback is, that it is not so easy to get out there if you are in town. The public transportation route planner came up with this solution: take t
There is a truck parking on the both sides of the road. A lot of drivers - very probably you can hitch something.
I got a drive to Kecskemet after 20 min. Good place for Kecskemet and Szeged.
It took us /male and female) 3 h to get a lift
It is a bad place but no choice if you want to go to Szeged.
Before the \"highway\" sign. Szeged direction.

there were few cars and the few cars were all full. Waited there for hours and ask around. After 3,5 h another hitchhiking team arrived. We cooked some pasta and afterwards both teams found a lift. Two amazing people took us with a Tesla

Really good spot for the direction to Budapest. It didn‚Äôt took long until a friendly Hungarian man took us in the heart of Budapest. You can also sleep under the trees without being seen by the people

If you‚Äôre going to Balaton, do not stop here. It‚Äôs an awful spot in this direction. We waited for more than three hours and we didn‚Äôt get a ride. Luckily a car carrier trailer stopped and the driver gave us a lift to a better stop in direction of Balaton (5 mins by car further South). Almost everyone stopping at this petrol station is going to Budapest, so this direction is probably better.
I liked this spot. Very easy to stop cars.
There weren't many cars there on a Saturday at noon. Nor shade. But not a bad place to hitchhike.

Done a quite a few changes to get a ride to the south 
But in the afternoon the active approach worked here for me. As always never loose hope my fellow hitchhikers üíõ:)

There is an Agip petrol station with medium traffic, I wouldn't say that that's the best spot ever, but I couldn't find better towards south. Mainly not local traffic stops there, you can get a lift to Szeged or to Serbia.
Waited 1h30 for a lift to Timisaora or Bucarest. Lot of Romanian Cars but traffic is not important. Thanks Richars
Not a lot of people go in direction of Serbia. Got a lift with a Serb.

Great spot if you're travelling to Romania, not so great for Serbia. There's a city bus stop 10 minutes walk west the station from where you can get to Szeged and then the next OMV station by bus, which is 3km from the border. A driver told us you can only cross the border on foot on the crossing Horgos 2, but not on the highway one, so be aware of that.

Gas station with traffic. Mode of it goes to Romania but you have to be lucky and keep asking. I asked to the Serbian border and they ended taking me to Sofia (BG). You won‚Äôt have a better spot anyways
There is a lot of Romanians going long distance, just in 30 minutes we catched ride to Bra»ôov.
Tre facile al Budape≈ùto.
Not extremely frequent, but a pretty good HH spot where you will always get a ride, I am sure! :) Direction BUDAPEST!
Direction BUDAPEST. A lot of people going there... dont worry about the ride, will get yours! :)

Ni estis du teamoj de "tramprennen", ni, "la amerikaj knaboj", kaj Die Schleichmichels, provante atingi nian celon por tiu tago. Tie ni provis la ≈ùildon dum 6 km, por almena≈≠ atingi pli bonan trafikcirklon. Aliaj teamoj ricevis pli bonajn veturojn de ƒâi tie pli rapide, sed multe pli frue. Ni devis provi iun ajn strategion, kiu ekigus nin.
It's better to take the 6 not the M6, because almost nobody taking the highway.

I hitchhiked here once. It seemed a good spot to me, but i think more experience is needed. There were just a few cars passing by, but in my  opinion it's better, because this way they have space to stop.
Go to the M6 exit of the roundabout. There is enough space for the cars to stop, since the traffic is low and the lane is rather wide.
Spot looks decent, but the drivers just wouldn't stop. Tried sign, no sign and nothing worked. after 4h, we went and asked around until we got a ride

There is not a lot of cars willing to take 2 people, usually they had full cars. There is not much cars and the spot is in the sun. We stayed with two signs: Wien and Bratislava, which i recommend. Some trucks were comming to Budapest
Great spot but I might have just gotten lucky. Got a ride to Bratislava even though the family was not even going there.
Good place even if I think that I was lucky getting a ride to Vienna after 5 minutes
Actually pretty good place. You can catch cars both coming from the gas station and the local road crossing the highway.

It was July and many people were driving to Croatia etc. so it was very hard to find someone who have a free place :(
It's always better to ask drivers for a ride. In July it's 1/5 star
Very good spot. A lot of cars going in direction of Graz and Maribor. We got a lift waiting with ‚ÄúSlovenia‚Äù sign after less than 15 mins

Waited here for 3 hours in direction Croatia. It was afternoon of a weekday in late September and terribly low traffic. Most of the cars were going to Slovenia. At the end took whatever I could just to get out of there, Wouldn't like to hitch there again unless it's tourist season with many cars driving towards Croatian coast.

It's an OK spot, I found a lift with some Moldovan van Drivers after 30 mins to Ljubljana. Used this station for Ljubljana, not a bad spot but approaching drivers is necessary. I caught a lift with a Polish Van driver after maybe 15 mins asking around. [My Blog Post](http://www.hobospirit.com/budapest-to-ljubijana/)
Good place, found a lift quickly.

Small Petrolstation in the mainroad to the south.
Not a Lot Cars so u have to be lucky to Catch someone  whos working in Budapest and goes Back to the south. I think in the evening u have the best chances.
I didn't have any sign, just my thumb up. It was Eastern, hot sunny day. Almost no car stopping here. Got a ride after one hour to the next gas station, which was much better.
I use this place weekly to Szeged. Use a table with your destination, and there will be no problem. waiting time: ~10-30 min

I agree it is not a good place. Local cars, tankstelle is hidden.
After more than hour somebody took us to a more far away petrol station.
this place isnt a good one. because its hidden, fast nobody stops who goes south, just the local guys

I waited at the gas station with a "Wien/Bratislava" sign but no one picked me up. The night was beginning to fall and I tried on the other spot next to the bridge to no success. I ended taking a bus to Wien

A good place if you're heading north (CZ/SK/Wien) but there is mostly locals and not enough tourists. We got lucky and got a ride to the border. Unfortunately it was too late in the evening so we decided to take a train from Hegyeshalom to Wien (nobody went to check out tickets there so we rode for free lol).
We had a sign for CZ/SK, but I think Wien or Bratislava would be better if you're going to Czechia (Brno).

Good Petrolstation to go to Szeged or further.
We Met a guy u bought us Gulasch and when he droped us at the next Station Close to Szeged he gave us 100 Euros. Thanks Adrian
It was alright, traffic towards Szeget as well as to Romania
Towards Szeged

We waited for 4 hours at this spot and nobody stopped for us. In the end, we slept by the roadside, and the next day we went to a new spot because no one would stop here. Our direction was M7 Ljubljana.
This spot is good if you want to hitchhike in the direction of Balaton, Croatia, Slovenia on M7, or to Austria or Slovakia on M1.
for direction gyor/budapest there is not really good spot to stand but it is ok. I got a lift to gyor quite fast but maybe i was just lucky
fast cars and unseen corner
There was a good traffic there still needed to wait about 70 mins for two of us
If you go alone it's easy to get a ride from a truck driver if you talk to them but for more then one person (we were 2) it was quite hard to get a ride. There were always some cars/trucks around.
Ni estis du teamoj de "tramprennen" provantaj atingi nian celon por tiu tago. Tie ni provis la ≈ùildon de benzinstacio. ƒúi fine funkciis.

Ni estis du teamoj de "tramprennen" provantaj atingi nian celon por tiu tago. Sufiƒâe senhoma benzinstacio. Tuj kiam ni alvenis, la polico diris al ni ne iri al la ƒâefvojo. Homoj timis provi proksime al la elirejo. Sed ni faris tion ƒùis ni trovis iun.
ƒài tiu estis malfacila, la polico eƒâ haltis por kontroli nin, kaj du junaj frenezaj knaboj kondukis nin al M√≥hacs.
Quite some cars, cars can stop at bus stop. The evening before no one stopped for us (waited 1hrs)
Thumbed with Beretty√≥ujfalu sign.
Not many cars going here, but they slow down and there is enough space to stop. No shadow though.
Ok spot by the bus station. We hitchhiked here while waiting for the bus and got a ride to Esztergom in 10 min. Enough space for the cars to stop and cars aren‚Äôt going too fast.
Busy Petrol station, but no one was going towards Romania. Many people to Budapest though. We ended up going to the other side of the roundabout which seems to be very good if you want to go east
Gas station is more or less destroyed, so you have to hitchhike on the road with thumb. Middle traffic, all going to Szeged. Got a ride quite quickly.
We arrived at 20:00 and didnt get a ride that day. Next day we also didnt get away, we were trying to get to northern romania. Good Infrastructure but no lifts. Might be good for other directions

First we were trying to find a ride at KFC exit, right next to the highway entrance. Looked like a good spot, but nobody stopped, maybe it was because the Mol gas station was closed. Definitely would be easier if it was opened. Then we change to this bus stop and we got a ride in less than 10 minutes.

For the first 30 minutes we have waited at a roundabout closer to the M7 highway entrance. Then we changed to this spot, there is a crossroad so the people take more attention to the pedestrians, there is also a lot of space for the cars to stop at a bus stop.

We have waited at the resting stop for a little bit, but there were only truckers going to sleep after their shift. Once every 10 minutes one car came, but they didn‚Äôt want to give us a ride, or they couldn‚Äôt. Then I went 400 meters into the highway and tried to signal the cars to stop at the stop with the sign in hand.
It‚Äôs alright spot, because almost every single car going by goes at least around or through Budapest.
Fast traffic, but maybe in the city it's better.
Not a lot of traffic and there is a little place to stop. We got a ride with sign "Budapest" to Fot, which is next to M2 highway.
Decent spot for m1 motorway

Bus stop, nothing extra but usable.
Cars were driving bit too fast and there was a lot of trucks
No traffic at all but not a bad place if youre heading to Budapest

When I arrived at this spot I felt very pessimistic - a very rare car coming through and mostly trucks stopping for sleep breaks.

Once I approached a truck driver, he agreed to pick me up next morning after he had slept.
The next morning I got the longest distance ride I had ever gotten by hitchhiking - took me all the way to Pa≈Üeve≈æis (Lithuania).
A local ex-hitchiker picked us up here, told us it's an awful place to catch anything and took us to M5 highway for a better place.

Small station, majority of cars drive to Ukraine, but I was trying to get to Romania, so probably it's easier if you are going to UA. The trucks stop only when they have to take a long 12h break to sleep.
Spot ok to go on the direction of Balaton. For the road 7 it's better I think. We waited 45 min, but there is a little of space for a car to stop and to not be in danger on the side of the road.
February 15, 2023. It was an okay spot, but it has less traffic than the new border crossing point. We got a ride to Zagreb.
I walked all across the village until I got a lift. Not the best place but you'll get a ride.
Trucks are parking here for their 15 or 45 minute breaks. Just around 5-6 trucks around lunchtime, but enough to ask them directly to get a ride towards Budapest or Szombathely.
Only good for local rides
Only good if going to Buda, nothing going east

I waited at the end at the exit of the gasstation to the motorway (that way i could try thumbing for both cars and all the trucks) with a sign for Szolnok, not many seemed to go that direction‚Ä¶ finally though, i got a truck all the way to Oradea (Romania) :)

This is the beginning of the city. There is a lamp. Many motorists show that they only come to the city. I used it many times when I didn't feel like walking to the other end of town. Towards BUDAPEST,EGER, M3.

Visibility not so good, cars going fast. There isn‚Äôt really a proper bay to pull in the car but there is a bus stop. We were waiting with Keszthely sign and got a lift to Balatonfured after 30 mins. Probably we got quite lucky. I think it is the best way here to travel by small distances.
The place has a small market attached, so a few people stop and rest.
The cars can stop and drive quite slowly, but there aren't that many people that stop. I think many people stay in the city. In the end we did get a ride towards the bulgarian border.
Lucky to get a ride. A vietnamese dude stopped and went until Budapest.
Still a small petrol station, despite of Burger King, which has more local clients. Luck us the highway got jammed and we got a ride from one of the crowling cars

Its kind of a small gasstation, not that many cars come by. Personnel have no problem with hitchhikers. Most people here go to Gyor, Bratislava or Vienna. I waited here 5 hours because I wanted to get to the M85 going south of Austria. I highly not recommend to take that as a direction since the majority simply doesnt go this way. Going via Vienna and then south is better. Cheers
Great spot if you are going to Austria / Slovakia (trucks, personal cars)

I was waiting here for almost 5 hours! From 09:10 to 13:55, Friday, August, at first with one guy, and from 10:50 alone. Terrible place. Finally, took drive to Mosonmagyarovar. Spot looks good, but for me it was really terrible on that day.
Good spot to go to Gy≈ër or Wien, Austria.

Really bad place to hitchhike. There is a lot of homeless people around this place, which means they annoy the drivers and they just leave the place as soon as possible. If you are heading towards Szeged/Serbia/Romania, make it yourself easier and take the train to In√°rcs-Kukacs and walk to the gas station over there. It takes 40 minutes from the railway station but it is the best option for you.
I was going south towards Szeged and previous two spots a bit north didn't work for me. In the end, I have managed to get a ride from here to a nearest gas station on the highway.

Use subway to get to Hatar ut and walk 10 min here. There is a bus stop and a lot of space to stop for the cars. Those are going to M5 will have to stop on traffic lights so they can see you. It's rather average spot, as it's still in city (it's better to go by train out of budapest), but it's possible. Drivers are looking your way here.
We hitchhiked in the night so it was pretty hard. After a while we finally got a ride near Budapest

Try the gas station just next to this spot! We got a lift to Budapest in 20 mins there, by a truck driver. I think the station is a good spot to North direction. 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), 20 mins
Don't deal with it! I've got bad memories (to Budapest, to the city centre). The cars are very fast and could't stop. Use the next (northern from here) motorway exit.
I got a lift here in less than 5 minutes. Based on the review of others I might just had luck.
Motorway connection in Romanian side  is in use now so cars use this
Probably not the best place to go east,but not bad if you are leaving from Szeged. We got a ride to Arad in a very short time
from szeged to east (mak√≥) nobody use this short motorway, because there's the old Route43, so tihs point is senseless. to romania (for example timisoara) try szeged-sz≈ëreg

Direction: east
Very little traffic going east, no long-distance rides. Standing on the highway might work better.

You should NOT hitchhike here. First there is always heavy traffic on this road and the cars have very little space to stop so it is dangerous.

Second: car at this spot goes to very different directions. Some will take the highway, some will go to north some to east.

It is an extremely inpractial spot. You should go couple hundred meters to east either to the highway intersection (if you'll go towards Budapest or Debrecen) or to over the big roundabout under the bridge.

Honestly I have

It's a useful place, there is an unused cross section, where the cars have a lot of plalce to pull over, in addition there is a traffic lamp 100 meters before. Get there by bus 7 or Auchan (free) from the center.
Pretty good place, you just have to stay at the right place,
If you want to go to Budapest, avoid this place by all means. Use the southern Miskolc area.
not a good placw, arrived at 6 p.m and didnt catch anything. Next day after sleeping in woods, romanian guy took as to Szeged.There are a lot of hungarian people who dont want to take hitchhikers.

There was no one going towards Slovenia or Croatia. Everyone was local people, and on top of that the gas station was under reconstruction. Only the McDonald's was open, but even there it was just locals.
Better then the station before will be even better if they finish renovating patrol station

Big gas station before the border but barely any traffic , mostly only lorry drivers. One of them took us to the border , but there we had to get off because most trucks can only carry 2 persons by law.

Big gas station just before the Hungary/Serbian border. The gas station has a lot of abandoned cars, so it looks like it's full, but in reality is totally empty and not so many cars stop here. I asked different polices in different times if I could walk from there to the border control. The first police said no, bu hours latter the second police said that I was allowed to walk on the grass just beside the road. Right before giving up at the gas station, a guy took me from here to Macedonia (FYRO

As a 2 lanes road, is tricky to get a ride. But you have some shades in the park, a gas station in the other side, and a fruit stand so some people will stop.
Wait near the pedestrian crosspath
Race: tramprennen.org 2023
Wrong place to soak in the direction of Slovenia on the highway, because many people are visiting local and from the surrounding area. Good place for a further visit to Lake Balaton.
